citation.article-title: Methermicoccus shengliensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic, methylotrophic methanogen isolated from oil-production water, and proposal of Methermicoccaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methermicoccaceae (Me.ther′mi.coc.ca′ce.ae. N.L. masc. n. Methermicoccus type genus of the family; suff. -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Methermicoccaceae the family of the genus Methermicoccus).
Methanol, methylamine and trimethylamine are used as substrates for methanogenesis.
The definition of the family is determined primarily by phylogenetic analyses of the 16S rRNA gene.
The DNA G+C content is >50 mol%.
The family currently contains a single genus.
The type genus of the family is Methermicoccus.
